English: Hurry, hurry!
Hurry up already!
Ugh, I'm so bored...
What's taking everybody so long? It's just digging.
I mean, how many months have we been at this already?
Um... Second Lieutenant.
It hasn't even been five minutes since we started working at this site...
And none of us have been able to get any rest for the past couple of days...
Since this is an area where we don't get any energy signals...
I would ask that you give us some more ti...
Why are you still talking?
Pa-pardon?
Burn!
Ahhhhh!
For-forgive me!
This is so annoying!
Do you know how annoying it is having to repeat myself over and over?
Go dig some more if you have time to be making excuses!
Go! Make haste!!
Aghhhh!
Who knew our new superior would be such a crazy maniac?!
I only came because they told me I would be paid big time...
Such hard work...
Without the slightest hint of anything...
Ack! I can't do this anymore!
Just looking at dirt makes me want to throw up!
Please... Let me sleep...
Or at least let me sit for a little while!!
How is this any different from the battlefield?
The battlefield was actually better than this!
I-I can't go on like this anymore!
We're going to die if we keep working like this!
Let's go!!
Here we go again...
We're all dead.
Hmm?
Le-let us rest!
We can't do this anymore— we're exhausted!
If this is how things are going to be, let us go back to the Empire!
There isn't anything in these areas you've commanded us to dig!
I would say that this reflects incompetence on the managing part!
Oh?
Yes! We may be soldiers, but that doesn't mean you can exploit us on meaningless work!
If you don't listen to what we have to say—
We have no choice but to... to do this!
Heh, this is going to be fun...
Who wants to die first?
Ahhhhhhhhh!
Heheh, how was that just now?
My butt is on fire!!
Sick people need medicine, don't they?
Ta-da! Have some of 'incompetent' Pansirone's special dose of medicine!
Here's another dose! And another one!
Kyahahahah!
Help!!!
Two months after the disbandment of the Hound Unit.
So the Hound Unit has been disbanded after all.
I wouldn't say the disbandment was entirely uncalled for,
But it would be a pity to leave them scattered like this.
Especially the head of the unit.
It seems as though the higher-ups of the army have deemed him as dangerous as of right now.
You can't exactly control someone that just lost what was most precious to him.
Blinded by revenge as he is, whether he poses as a dangerous threat or as an advantageous benefit would be up to how you were to utilize him.
To me, it only seems as though the higher-ups are just afraid of him because of what they've done.
I can sense something unusual is about to happen.
No matter how I think of it, it's still a pity.
...I think I better pay him a visit sometime soon.
Sir?
So, where have the other members gone?
Uh, yes.
According to my research, Second Lieutenant Kibera has been transferred to Orvelia following Advisor Idrian's orders.
I wasn't able to find out the exact reason why, but it seemed like a personal reason.
From what I've been told, he isn't originally from the Empire.
If it weren't for his unit's missions, he didn't have any reason to stay.
The army appears to have made the call that he doesn't pose much of a threat. They didn't take any extra measures when he left the country.
That's too bad. He was one of the few who could recognize Veralta's beauty.
Second Lieutenant Mitra has gone missing.
I heard the army is tracking him down, as he was always known to cause quite the trouble.
That white-head— he's an open book.
The real problem is this one.
Hahaha. This unit really is full of excitement.
Not one of them lets me down.
So did Second Lieutenant Pansirone go back to the division she came from?
Yes, sir. It looks like she's been reassigned to the Machine Division after the disbandment of the Hound Unit.
But she... Um...
I've been told she is currently unfit to be put on any duty.
I mean, she was always known to be...
I can imagine.
The head of the Hound Unit was, indeed—
the only person who could really control her.
Who could take her unpredictable violent temper, with her reigns set loose... Fufufu.
I hear she's throwing a tantrum about how she will only do what she wants to do.
Headquarters is doing nothing to hide their disapproval,
but then again, her abilities are far too dangerous to have her discharged dishonorably...
Well, it's not exactly something the royal family needs to concern about.
I guess the army decided it would be better to hold on to her as an ally than to create yet another threat.
Yes, that seems to be the case.
From the looks of it, it appears as though they have settled on forcibly assigning her to difficult battles.
If she were to refuse that as well, then... I assume the only option left for her would be removal.
Could that really be the best they could do?
It would be a shame to have her expended after such a short usage.
But there doesn't seem to be any other reasonable options.
Hmm...
I have a good idea.
Six months after the disbandment of the Hound Unit.
Eeeeek! This is so much fun!
Ahahahah!
Yeeee! Next! Next!
My lady, the context of your smiles seem to be quite inappropriate.
What the-! You scared me!
Ah, excuse me.
My choice of words in calling you—a soldier in the army— 'lady' seems to have been inappropriate as well.
Who the hell are you?!
I've been sent by the imperial palace to suggest a new assignment for you.
Oh-ho! The imperial palace, huh?
Not interested!
Hmm, this is one assignment you're going to find interesting.
Yup, that's what all my other useless visitors kept on saying!
So I gave them all a little taste of fire on the buttocks! Hehe.
I'm in the middle of something really important and am really busy right now.
Could you go away, please?
Ahahaha! Hehehehehe!!
Ah, this book. I just finished reading it recently.
Ahahahahah! Hehehehe!
You're on Volume 28?
Ahahahah! Hehe!!
The final book, Volume 30, ends the story with the biggest twist.\nThe main character dies because he tripped on his own foot.
Ahah...
*Hiss* Why would you tell me that?!
I was at the good part!
Now it's no fun!
I told you not to bother me!!
What if I were to tell you something far more amusing?
I'M-NOT-INTERESTED!!!!
Here's a load of fire for you!!
You won't regret hearing it.
I don't want to!!
Ah. What a beautiful flame.
As charming as it may be,
Do you really think its heat could reach me?
Wow, just you wait! I'm really going to burn you up!
Don't beg me later!
Die! Die!!
Burn!!
Grrrr, why won't you freaking die?!
Gahhh! This is so annoying!!
Ah. It seems this waltz has run its course.
Let me get back to what I came here for.
Your skills are indeed, flawless.
We wouldn't want to have them put to waste.
Ugh, this is so frustrating!
I heard you've been refusing all of your assignments at the Machine Division.
Don't you dare change the subject!
Then what about excavation?
Since it's something you've done countless times in your old unit, I assume it would come easy to you.
Huh, looks like someone did a lot of digging around on my life.
Cree-py.
You could say I tried my hand to win you over.
Hah, and you think that's going to change my mind?
Sorry to burst your bubble!
There isn't anything that could interest me now.
The army finds these actions of yours very difficult to deal with.
I think you would have a far better idea than I do regarding what they will do if you don't cooperate with them.
No, I don't!
I-haven't-got-a-clue! Bleh!
You will be forced to be a part of an assignment regardless of what you think.
Wow, that really wouldn't be my cup of tea.
If worse comes to worst, they may try to remove the uncontrollable soldier.
Well, tell them to!
But I wouldn't want that to happen.
I take extremely good care of talented people, you see.
Even more so for people like you.
Even if they're a little lacking in character.
Ugh! You're really annoying!
I wouldn't think execution would be something the head of the army would want either.
Why would they want to suffer a loss when they could utilize you in so many ways?
What are you talking about?
What I'm saying is that the army could make things go back to the way things were before you met them—
To those times when you— and only you— survived from that horrible place.
No matter how many times, how many years it takes, they will stop at nothing to recreate the super-soldiers from those times. Their sense of morality is nothing short of trash.
And all of it started with you, the only survivor.
Wouldn't you say they would think it's a shame to put such a precious resource to waste?
Ah, of course, that facility no longer exists.
Huh. I've had enough of you.
Oh dear. That flame looks ready to pounce at me if I were to say one more word.
I'll stop here for your sake.
But I do want you to think carefully about the offer on excavation.
Not only is it similar to what you've done before,
you'll be set free from the army's pressure in the name of the imperial palace's duties.
You would be killing two birds with one stone.
How dare you order me around?!
I am the Vice Commander of the Imperial Knights.
Blah! What do I care?
It means I'm more powerful than you think when it comes to working in the name of the Emperor.
Ugh, bug off! Get out of here!!
This power does come in handy, you know.
For instance, I could find out how anyone you've parted with is doing.
What do you want from me?
I'm only trying to tell you.
You may be surprised what you may be able to find if you were to fulfill your duties compliantly.
Seven months after the disbandment of the Hound Unit.
Your assignment is simple.
Find something in the place I tell you to.
And what would I be looking for?
That has yet to be discovered.
Wow, soooo simple!
Why don't you just do it yourself?!
Unfortunately, this just isn't something I'm able to do, which is why I handpicked you especially.
I hate you.
The place I'm about to tell you,
is a place where our high-energy tracking signals for excavation show no reaction at all.
In short, it's a place where no artifacts could be.
Did you even hear what I just said?!
But the ancient book I've been studying with interest has mentioned\nnone other than that area as an important territory.
When I went and examined the place myself, it was just as the reports read.
On top of unable to find any energy signals whatsoever,
the terrain was rough, and the weather irritably fickle.
The land was beyond insignificant—it was the worst.
Count me out!
I don't want to do it!!
What the heck!
You're just doing this to give me a hard time!
I'm not going to get anything digging through a place like that!
You're right. I wasn't able to find anything—not even an ant.
I've assigned numerous people to the place since then,
but without any fruition.
Scholars have long been sick of it,
and a considerable number of troops assigned to the excavation abandoned the site.
Officers who are in charge of the site have also been replaced numerous times.
Huh, is that so?
And you're telling me this unfortunate little place is my assignment?
Screw it! I'm not doing it!!
Yes, it really is quite unfortunate.
But wouldn't you say your old unit conducted work just like this?
There's also one more reason why I sought after you in particular.
The ancient book I've based the excavation on—
A sentence that was recently decrypted from that book changed everything about the situation.
What, now you're talking about some stupid words?
With this one sentence,
I was able to figure out why we had never been able to find anything from the land,
as well as who it was I needed to turn to.
Stop talking in riddles! You're driving me nuts!!
'Only those who can see what cannot be seen will be able to reach.'
Who could that be?
Perhaps...
Someone who claims to see flames that no one else is able to see?
Haha. Look at you.
I wish you would stop glaring at me like that— it's scary, you know.
Didn't I say I put in quite the work to get to know you?
YOU!!!
ARGHHH!!!
You're EXTREMELY annoying!!
I'm going to KILL you!!!!
I swear I'm going to burn you up!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
You're the only one that could complete this assignment.
At least among the people I know.
It has to be there...
The only book that endured from the remnants of the fallen republic...
The same coordinates that have been obsessively scrawled across all over the pages.
Something feels off... as if it's desperately trying to point out something...
Although I'm not sure what that may be.
I get the sense that it will be anything but ordinary.
It has to be there.
It needs to be there.
So now you're pretending to be all serious?!
Ah. I got carried away.
I shall spare you the unnecessary details beyond this point. I wouldn't want to bore you.
Anyway, you're the right person for this job.
You're the only one. Second Lieutenant Pansirone, ex-Hound Unit.
Second Lieutenant Pansirone! I order myself joining the Hound Unit!
And I order me as the Head of the Unit!
HA! Keep dreaming on your own.
And obviously, I'm the head!
Huh, now that's something I haven't heard before.
Mister, who are these dumb-looking people?
What an exciting group!
Are you seriously telling me I'm with these nut-jobs?
Hm, I haven't said much.
I could burn you all up nice and crispy.
Shush. All of you.
Six months since the start of the artifact excavation.
Hah, whatever.
I'm only doing this because of those stupid people who won't leave me alone.
Are you still not done?!
Hurry up already!
AHHHHHH!
...Eeeek!
Huh..?
Why won't my shovel go down any further?
Huh??
Have you found something??
What is it??
I don't know, but my shovel keeps getting stuck.
Could... Could it be..?
The signal! Get the device!
H-Hold still.
I'm not getting anything.
Then what is...
Huh..?
Ahhh!!!
Th-the earth is shaking!!!!!
Earthquake!!!
Huh?!
At last?!
It's heeeeeeeeere!!!!!!!!!!!
Se-second Lieutenant! What are you doing?
Come back!!
Wheeeee!!!
Huh?
It's a rock.
Pa-pardon?
It's a rock.
It's just a rock! A rock!
Ugh... I don't see anything!
I knew that book was a stupid lie!!
Argh! This is SO annoying!!
Useless!
You fools!!
Burn! All of you!
AHHHH!
The si-signal!
The signal rates are becoming incredibly high!!!
Ahh! It's broken!!
Mine, too!
What the..!!
Ahhhhhhhhhhh!!!!
Hmm?
Woohoo! Look how tall they are!
*Beep* Warning. Warning.
Sensing unidentifiable, extreme heat.
Exceeding acceptable maximum value.
Stealth mode damaged.
Attempting recovery.
Whoa! Cool!
The rock is talking!
...Recovery failed.
Data permanently damaged due to extreme heat.
Unable to activate Stealth mode.
Enter admin registration code.
Huh? What's that supposed to mean?
Hehe, I'm just going to burn it up!
Incorrect code. Incorrect code.
Activating security system.
Target locked.
Attack.
Hee... If you pick a fight like that, you're gonna get me too excited!
Security system partially damaged.
Attempting recovery.
Eeek! You guys are fun!
Eh, no burn?
How about if I do this? Or this?!
Security system damaged.
Attempting recovery.
Recovery failed.
Re-attempting recovery.
Recovery failed...
Security system destroyed.
Activating self-destruction system.
Huh?!
What the?! Where did it all go?!
I was just getting started! Darn.
Se-second Lieutenant!
What if we were to send in those rocks?
I can't get anything on my signal device because it's broken...
But since they came out after we defeated a monster, they must be something important!
Yay! We did it!
Hurrah!!
Ugh, shut up!
Can't you see that I'm mad because the fun is gone?!
Gahhhh! SO ANNOYING!!
BURN!
Second Lieutenant!! Please calm down!
Ahhhhh! She's at it again!!
Artifact Excavation Report
- Earthquake occurred.
- Was playing with rocks, which suddenly melted
- Sending remaining stones that came out of those rocks
- Nothing apart from that. Seriously nothing.
- Hating this place
- P.S.
: Unfortunately, 30 soldiers are unable to work due to an unexpected accident
: All signal devices have been broken
This is nonsense.
Nothing makes sense, and every report talks about the loss of manpower.
Isn't the cause crystal clear?
If you compare it with the report from the person I have at the site,
it isn't like there's anything wrong in particular.
Since I wasn't there to see it, I wouldn't be able to specify on anything,
but it seems clear that they engaged in battle with something.
And take a look at this.
After all that fuss, all she sent in are these petty stones.
They are definitely reacting to the signal devices, though.
As if they're in resonance.
We-well yes...
I guess you could call that peculiar.
But they still look like stones to me, no matter how I look at them!
(They did endure her flames. And this situation...
There's more to this than meets the eye.)
Look, each piece has a groove.
...Just as I thought. These have been carved in intentionally.
Sir?
See here.
I'm about to perform some magic.
Huh?!
Weren't they all individual stone pieces??
Th-this...
This looks like a map...
(This symbol on the end here.
It's clearly a pattern of the Republic of Gray.
But this map could hardly be seen as the republic's territory.
Then where could it be?)
...Could it be?
Hahaha... Wow...
Right, of course.
This is what the book wanted to tell us.
Uh.. Vice Commander, I'm not sure I understand.
I was right to choose her.
Since we've reaped more than what I could've imagined,
I'll let the issue concerning the loss of manpower pass.
Tell the site to pull out.
I'm going to need to find out if there are any related clues from the Ruins at Gargoss.
(The treasure left behind by the republic to continue their great work.)
(This is it.)
(It's a map to the Technomagic Kingdom.)
(...I need them.)
We're finally pulling out!
Ugh, I've had enough of this place.
I never want to see her as my superior again!
I doubt there's anyone here who doesn't have a burn on their buttocks.
It really was an odd assignment.
I still think they look like trash, but thank goodness we at least discovered those stones!
I'm so glad to be going back...
Huh.
Idiots. I bet they don't know this came out of those rocks.
Tersia, you remember, right?
Thanks to him, I know what this is. Heh.
It's an ore that's used by laboratories.
Don't touch it, as it may explode.
Especially you, Pansirone.
Heh, there's no way I'm going to help those suckers so easily.
If I go back, they're sure to go back to racking their brains, figuring out when and how to take advantage of me.
If I were to throw this into the air right now,
And BOOM—shoot it—
Do you think it would burn everything that's in here?
Don't you think the fireworks would look lovely?
What's that? You think I would burn as well?
Hmm.
Then I guess I'll just burn with everything else!
Here I go!
Hey, what are you doing here?
Old man, check this out! Ahaha.
Hmm, I guess a little firework was in the works.
What if we were to shoot one up with him attached?
Shut up!
Heh. It would be so much more fun.
Old man! Do we really have to go with him?
Shush.
Stop dawdling and join the group.
...Ugh.
Heh.
I guess I could wait just a bit little longer.
